Description: Fragment of the body of a pale red-brown pottery jar, the fabric contains many small white inclusions, the exterior is covered with a cream-coloured slip and remains of two lines of black-painted hieratic text identifying the contents as meat for the birthday of the Aten (New Year's Day) and referring to the greatest of seers (high priest of the sun-god).
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Associated events: Named in Inscription: Birth of Aten
